TopicTitle: Kerbus Mini Mk2 Passenger Jet, Holds 20 Kerbals + Cargo Bay

Articles.Content:
Hey!!!! After many attempts I have finished my simple, practical passenger jet

It is pretty maneuverable for it's size, has RCS Stability assist and reverse thrusters, ladders and basic science. I had it going over 900 m/s but thats probably a bit dangerous haha.

The only problem is it seems to disintegrate when timewarping over 2x :/ suggestions appreciated!!

Action Groups:

1 - Toggle Main Engines

5 - Cockpit & Passenger Module Lights

6 - Toggle Ladder

Made in KSP 1.04

DOWNLOAD CRAFT FILE: https://www./?0bqrtwbb8dud7a2

Edited August 23, 2015 by JTMilne
Added Action Group Controls :)
I like it! Good design, especially with the engines mounted on the elevators.
I play ksp so much I read nut as in metal screw.

I like it! Good design, especially with the engines mounted on the elevators.

Thanks!! I tried to keep it simple, part count is 80-something

Sorry, but I didn't get it to work right off the runway. It was as if most of the fuel was inaccessible. I had to add fuel flow pipes from the front to the back. Is this something I was doing wrong? And I could only get it up to about 20KM. Should it be able to go into space? If so, was it from taking off on the runway or putting on a stack with boosters or something?

1 hour ago, GalacticZero said:

Sorry, but I didn't get it to work right off the runway. It was as if most of the fuel was inaccessible. I had to add fuel flow pipes from the front to the back. Is this something I was doing wrong? And I could only get it up to about 20KM. Should it be able to go into space? If so, was it from taking off on the runway or putting on a stack with boosters or something?

JETS DON'T GO TO SPACE KTHXBYE

6 minutes ago, The Optimist said:

JETS DON'T GO TO SPACE KTHXBYE

 

K, while that was a bit rude in the way you said it, I guess I was at fault for not realizing what I was saying. I do know that, I just had a brainfart. Part of it was because of the one image that had the atmospheric heating on the craft. It looked like it was coming back from space. PLUS, it has a docking port on the front of it. Those two things alone make it appear to be space worthy.


That still doesn't fix the issue with the fuel not flowing completely from all tanks. It empties out the gas in the engines and then shuts down. I have to manually transfer fuel from all the other tanks to keep them lit.
It's a really old design and probably is not built for this version of KSP, you should never expect designs over a couple of months old to work.
